response.feedback: Incorrect. Although a person with a very low blood pressure may have a “faint” pulse, this measurement is better at indicating a different variable.
Incorrect. The pulse does not provide much information about stroke volume.
Incorrect. Pulse is measured in the large arteries, which have little vascular resistance. Therefore pulse is not indicative of vascular resistance.
Correct. Heart rate is determined by counting a person’s pulse over a specified time period.

part.hint: A pulse is created by the moving wave of pressure associated with expansion and recoiling of the arteries after every systole.
